hackathon-description-text: RowdyHacks is a 24-hour competitive programming event in which, teams of students work together to “hack” a website, app, or tool. Whether you have never written a line of code or you are a seasoned programmer, RowdyHacks is for everyone! Use RowdyHacks to your advantage to learn and gain valuable skills, increase your network, boost your resume and have fun.
hackathon-eligibility: Undergraduate University students in the San Antonio Area are welcome to attend.
hackathon-rules: RowdyHacks is adhering to the MLH Code of Conduct which all partcipants must follow. Please review the Code of Conduct here: https://static.mlh.io/docs/mlh-code-of-conduct.pdf
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=110 E Houston St, San Antonio, TX 78205, USA
hackathon-location-address: 110 E Houston St, San Antonio, TX 78205, USA
